poems.title: On the Doorstep of your Studio, while you Sleep Within
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"Wa laylee itha sajaa" *

I sit between a long-legged
Thin spider that rests in the corner of a
Midnight plant.
And to my right, a small slug.
I am snug in between them both
The night is theirs
I am the visitor.

I have come on Earth to taste sweetness
To watch spiders
See fences errected
Closed flowers under the black mixture of
Moon and fog.

Faraway light that leaves
And the distant sound, also faraway
Of neighbourhood sirens and conflict
Small and dry sound
Like the spider
It is never far
Our father of death.

For these years of life
The truthful clouds
Pluming and roseing
Blooming and passing
Have watched me as I watched them
They have seen how

poems.title: Echoing of Chasmic Vervours
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Firey hands touch the material and
Everything burns up to
Immediate flame 

The game is gone and
The hand is played

When the point of breathing at nothing comes 
Your chasmic vervour 
Shimmers as a black patch upon a 
Lava crawl 

Everything will melt unto 
Pure nothing 

The body a sumptuously devoured flake bidden bye

A mind that made a million molehills is now one with the mountain

A fountain of Divine lava 
The final sentence of Gods love in this life
The crumbling meandering overwashing that must happen
To all forms
Before gas and spirit 
begin to form
Anew 

The Godliness of us 
Marks us

We can’t go quietly 
We are so Divine we 
Will never shut down

Like some silly line 
A child drew 
We keep on flowing 
From river to sea 
     and
From sea we 
Are siphoned off into 
Eternity

poems.title: az gul amadee
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Prime coming. 
A sure force
Aligning such that
Two rhythms and
     Timelines begin merging.

~

Channels untucked.
   Rapidly dissipating residuals
  That which remains of the statue 
  Is what love refused to
        Cast away.   

~

Sixteen places out
Uncategorized peripheries

In dreams we met there
And in life we are
   Trying to square the clouds
   Into something
   The sun can shine on.

poems.title: Plane to Medina
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Bigger than generational wealth 

A calling into the future
Down the everlong tunnel of my descendants
Here we were, I’ll say
On each others shoulders
Gifting you the latest transmissions 

We heard and obeyed
Passed on what we could
May He have mercy on us
What limitations we were bound by!
Love and loneliness and living in a time of 
Dis ease and desperation

Aside from our darling period, before we came of age, 
It has all been a storm. 
We’ve weathered it as best we could 
For your sake

For your sake, o our children!

Calling you from where you listen 
In heavenly oceans 
Awaiting birth awaiting love
Awaiting your come up

You don’t know how much we
Long for you
To be among us
Back where you belong

Oh my child!
Precious child!
Stay forever while you leave
Stay by my side forever 
My beauty…

I will watch you grow
Out of what I was
And into yourself

And only then will I know
My time has come
To let go.

My perfume purpose 
Having filled this earth 
My scent stamped and 
My descendants ready, 

Able 
to 
Run.

poems.title: Remembering Carmel
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Can glass be blown backwards 
      Can solid go back to liquid?

We keep fantasizing about it
In films and in
Showers as we close our eyes
And in sexuality as we liquify

We walk timidly towards the ocean 
.It’s cold, and that scares us.
But we still go there
And we still want to be in it

The liquid crystal embalming us
The water now warm 
A rhythm emerging in our minds 
We swaying and our arms waving 
Dizzying off as some
Lovely slimey thing
Tickles our ankles and small toes

Where have we gone?
What is this familiar place?
Where is my mother if 
This is origin?

Or does this go back further?
It might because 
I can see stars up in this pale blue sky.

And I see globes that were planets
And beyond them 
Beyond all
Known science
A slanted door
To another realm 

The door is the size of all the universes I just saw 
And the realm behind it is so limitless that 
Concepts like size are gone

I open my eyes 
waist deep in this 
clear blue
angelness

As I re-emerge onto the beach 
The people look at me strangely 
Even though I walk one pace at a time
With my limbs I have.

The beach people have tinny instruments that emit sound waves
Poor quality transmissions on limited frequencies of 
Sound with no width in 
Any sense.

Crimes against humanity look like this
A sleepy forgetfulness

And as I notice the curve of her summer dress
I smile remembering 
I am rejoining this 
Beautiful mess.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Linear Marouf 
Merciful lines scar the sky 
Say a sangeen fare thee well 
Holding out one hand that waves
Emotion unspoken and if it be received
As a hard token, so be it. 
Everything in its time falls
Passions rise and inevitable
Loves eyes and its back of minds 
Where the boys go running
And the girls hiding
A dark void to be 
Alone 
and feel.

poems.title: Goodbye
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Goodbye my heart

Radiant beauty is yours
I’ve seen it and touched it 
I’ve been inside you
You wept and couldn’t speak

But you gush open and your
Body 
Waters your heart. 

Every secret in you and
Every formulation within the grasp of your fine mind

But 
         the dancing and the 
                                                 stillness: 
   Less trodden
   Less traversed 
   Less tickled.

poems.title: Desires
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Parody becomes reality  
The absurd blends imperceptibly into our daily dose  
Before we know it we are nodding in agreement  
Buying everything, seriously 
Like a German listening intently to a sarcastic joke they don’t get.    

We are capable of sinking like a stone to the bottom of a filthy pond  
So much can be added to our weight
So quickly, new desires can become ours  
And we long for it, and it acts us out 

We move in ways we never would  
Miming out the persona of someone we don’t recognize  
Praying for something we never thought we wanted 

Strangers to ourselves  
No hearts within us  
But awash with these new desires 
All that remains are the desires in us  

Clicking us into movement as our limbs 
Jerk into action and sprawl us across the cities.

poems.title: A Poem for Electronica Musicians
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sometimes I wonder if 
I sold my soul to the arpeggiator   

Sometimes I wonder if  
I let the wrong one in  

Sometimes I wonder if  
I've been surfing a wave that isn't my own  

Sometimes I wonder if  
I could drop all the coins and start anew  

Firey teardrops velveting down my mountainous robes
Into the black chasm that takes three days to reach 
The earth of earth 
Wherein lies a bubbling spring

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
far reaching star unfolds  
there has been sand that  
feels for me rising  
feels for me  
sun in my hand   

in my mouth  
there is  
crystal spuck  

real fabrication  
spitting out mist  
emitting rarified  
luck

landing upon your  
shoulders ive come  
to hold you from  
behind and place 
hands upon your 
lower back that  
energize and ironize  
glueing you 
contagious   

i hold your breath 
in my palms i will  
heal you               
               r skin  
through skin  
i encounter 
essence  

your ink 
before it made words 

your dark ink  
that i saw and know 
before it filled your  
receptacle and  
made float 

your vessels 
i knew your  
inky origins  

and everything that you do  
would be as natural to me as  
water on my hands and  
interlocking my fingers and 
holding you from behind  
us locked in to one.

poems.title: Prep Coffee
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chimes echo out of the starlight  
A bird chases a squirrel down a tree 
Happenings in the orbital sky 
Twinkling stars and the look in your eye    

Touch me 
Don’t touch me 
Reach far in  

Love me 
Don’t come, just   
   Stay                     
                   as you are    

A far river 
In the eyes sunken distance 
The green, dreaming hills 
Melting without insistence  

Pie on the wind
Food from a lover prepared
Kindness pellets
Love, touch me by the air.  

*

They turn the volume down self-consciously when Nirvana comes on
They think it’s too rough for this sun
But really
The friction makes the moonlight smoother

poems.title: Sleepy Poem
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
My temple is certified and affluent when denied and dented, 
It fills with smoke which also clears, and settled suns which also rise. 
My tears are drowning fears which slowly vapour clear on up,
Cloud is me and you and all our pain that cries to feel relieved, 
Rain on earth is vapour, we are cycles, we are circles. 
All the time forgetting, 'til we turn and must remember.

poems.title: Twinners
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Adjoining rooms
   You visit me when mine is flooded
      richly with sun
   I’ll come to yours, too, 
      At the mirrored moment of our day
Correspondingly 
   We’ll talk water particles 
      into the sand particles 
         and our desert will 
           balance and lose
              its sting

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chiming is everything 

That’s the motto I live by 

I sit in a resonant room 
 of hammered metal pans
  gongs and tuning forks 
   but I make no move
     and in silence
      await you in 
       anticipation of 
        the noise you will 
         come with and 
          how each chime
           will dictate the 
            next moment

poems.title: Airways
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A trigonal
                 muck 
For six paces
       Keep your nose out of 
           my airspaces
                  
My airways aren’t yet clear
   It’s obvious and apparent 
    as blockages always are

The state of the world (burning)
    ironically requires long 
         cooling breaths 
           which in 
              turn
        necessitate 
       clear airways                     

Having experienced the serenity of regular meditation, 
I have become one of those lucky people who can say things like 
‘if only everyone (or enough people) could blow 
cool calming air onto the world 
things would change.'

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Salient touching stones
   mark up with clinks 
the noise re-arrangements 
and uncommon 
demanifestings 
all signed off 
unicorn signatures
avid signatories 
fiery tributaries
modern ritual flushers

poems.title: No Title
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
No one asked and 
   therefore never knew 
     of the goldfish that 
        swim inside me
      they tickle 
        and keep my torso 
          on its toes 

The manifesting gatherer 
  that lives in the center 
   of the berry forest
  wages all their fortunes 
   on the snow coming 
     out gold this   
      spring season 
         but the ax 
  wielding barbarian 
scientists have already 
set in motion the 
burning/harvesting schedule 
for the next 71 years
which is when they calculate
that all of the resources will 
finally be excavated and evaporated 
“then, and only then,” said Chuck
“Will we exit with dignity.”

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Mansion
               sell my home

I want to live with you
 my zip code will change to you
  and six of my seven names
   will become your names

     the straightest legendary lovers
      must become women
       it has to happen.

poems.title: In Every Injury
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I keep falling and in 
   every red graze 
                            on my knee
                      I see your
                    loving (of) me.

poems.title: Days
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I have to walk out to the gallows 
Each time I leave my home

  that’s what life begins to feel like

But I’m walking with freed will 
Knowing the torture is really 
  nurture.

poems.title: The Mountaineer — D E F R O C K E D
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I climb to the top of the ladder
 muezzin move
all to declare to the world
 that I’m a man 
   that, I promise, I’m a man. 

I can strike !
 make fire !
pound the mountain and 
stand on top. 

I can’t fly 
My thuddy vesture keeps 
heavy clods entrenched 
                                      in 
    soil and sod. 

I’m sad and small 
  Behind a nightingales call
My all, summarized
  and standing tall is
  aught but a speck
  of filigree dust

Must my shadow and 
    Ancestus reduce me 
      punishingly down
   to the lower-ranked
      classes?

If I don’t listen and
  take heed I surely 
    will achieve magnificence
      but only in the manner
        of my comeuppance 
    wherein a great white 
        thunder strike shall 
          seek my skull end 
                             and 
        fling me off
this goliath mound. 

Or, if the wise back-tredder
   is found within my 
      puffed-up foolery 
   and I tender my self 
     and step down 
     returning to my 
    simple village of chums
     where I was only 
      (but always) me… 



A carrot in the tree
 some later month or three
    just me alone 
 knees up by my ears
like I was twenty (and
   not forty) three
munching contentedly 
   as the orange sun 
     breaks free. 

“My family, I have
   they know me!”  
A satisfying, brave 
    crunch of nothing 
 to accompany my 
great economy epiphany

poems.title: "Shukran"
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"Shukran,"
spoken softly 

the warm chain 
that binds action
to ethic

poems.title: My Invisible Career circa. 2024
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
An infinite mind 
that keeps on 
creating new vistas 
and variations 

they never knew me 
and now they call it "A.I."

I laugh, because
nothing insults me

poems.title: The Future
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
wherever I have left 
to go 
awaits 
           me
    excitedly

poems.title: Fasting amongst average Muslims
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
'Don't use your mind,'
I want to tell the boy who is unaware
He is silhouetted by a sun 
in the window behind him
As he tells me energetically that 
it's too late for me to eat the food
that I've just been given. 
'Use your eyes!'

These salafis are taking
the most beautiful aspect of Islam
 - its nearness to nature - 
and are actively anesthetizing it
until eventually 
all that's left will be 
lux scents
marble floors and 
a golden statue 
of Cristiano Ronaldo.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
It's always night in space
Steps in floating zero 
Your astro hands up like
a mime or a helpless blind 
person 

Your eyes may as well be closed
Your lips smacking together feebly 
You are a dot 
                          passing through the great
Infinite.

poems.title: Lillianne aka Lily
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Lillanne Pharaohdust
 Lillyanne Thomlinson 
  Lillyanne of the pond and lake
    Lillyanne of the boudoir 
      (before it's too late)
    She applies blusher to her cheeks
       and stick to her cake hole
    She's been on fire since the day she was born
       Lillyanne desert 
          Lillyanne valley 
              Lilzy jokes by the poolside
                 Playing cards with the cool guys
                    Flowin jus like a moon tide
                      Glowin just like a moon rise 

              Cool Lily 
                                   Water Lily 
                  Moistily

poems.title: Pre Nuptual Eulogy
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
1
Oh God
Crack open the dark 
Prism in the
 dark chasm in
  the silent hole
    in me. 

If You scan Your ray 
    of light on 
  that hidden 
    shadow jewel 
  You will show me
    and the world
  what it means
     'being alive.'

I have never ever prayed 
   for electrocution 
   or destruction in my life. 

But if it be at Your loving hands, 
   "take me!" 

I give unto 
   I leave me
       to You. 

Flame away me
   My hands raised
      Like a flag up 
         in flames. 

I wave goodbye
  Left to right
     sway away 
        into the light. 

2
Maybe other things 
 will remain out
        lasting me
     I will accept 
      coming out early 

Ash. Toblerone. Booze. 
      I never felt right
      sharing the stage
    with so many games. 

When I was young I wanted 
   to cover everything 
      in flames. 

Now that I'm serious
  I ask only You God
    To flood my bloody 
        body with Your
        magic electrons
            and let me 
         join the ranks
         of the natural
                ones.
